Package com.github.tommyettinger.ds

Interface Ordered<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Arrangeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ObjectList, OrderedMap, OrderedSet
public interface Ordered<T>
extends Arrangeable
Ensures that implementors allow access to the order of T items as an ObjectList. This is meant to allow different (typically insertion-ordered) data structures to all have their order manipulated by the same methods. This interface extends Arrangeable, which itself is compatible both with primitive-backed collections like IntList and generic ones like the implementations of Ordered. This has default implementations of Arrangeable.swap(int, int) and Arrangeable.shuffle(Random).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    ObjectList<T> order()
    Gets the ObjectList of T items that this data structure holds, in the order it uses for iteration.
    default void reverse()  
    default void shuffle​(java.util.Random random)
    Pseudo-randomly shuffles the order of this Ordered in-place.
    default void swap​(int a, int b)
    Switches the ordering of positions a and b, without changing any items beyond that.

  • Method Details

    • order

      ObjectList<T> order()
      Gets the ObjectList of T items that this data structure holds, in the order it uses for iteration. This should usually return a direct reference to an ObjectList used inside this object, so changes to the list will affect this.
      Returns:
      the ObjectList of T items that this data structure holds

    • swap

      default void swap​(int a, int b)
      Switches the ordering of positions a and b, without changing any items beyond that.
      Specified by:
      swap in interface Arrangeable
      Parameters:
      a - the first position
      b - the second position

    • shuffle

      default void shuffle​(java.util.Random random)
      Pseudo-randomly shuffles the order of this Ordered in-place.
      Specified by:
      shuffle in interface Arrangeable
      Parameters:
      random - any Random implementation; prefer LaserRandom in this library

    • reverse

      default void reverse()
      Specified by:
